page.title: 02GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY
page.content:
The Bridport branch of the GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY ran from Maiden Newton through Toller Porcorum, Nettlecombe, Loders, Bradpole, Bridport and West Bay. It was opened in 1854. It cost Â£20,000 to build and it cost 9d old money to go on and it took one hour and a half from Maiden Newton to Westbay. It normally took 50 people and it also was a goods train. It was 10\ miles long and it had only one track. It was closed down because it did not pay enough money so it shut down. The people who wanted to keep the line open only needed Â£1,000 more to keep it open. But a landowner paid the recovery men to take the line up ten months before schedule.
CONTINUED ON PAGE 3
